newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran denies trying to buy nuclear arms components.
newsitem.headline: Iran denies trying to buy nuclear arms components.

text.p: Iran has denied a press report that it had tried to obtain from South Africa items needed to build nuclear weapons, and reiterated that its nuclear capability was for peaceful purposes.

Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation (IAEO) said in a statement late on Sunday that Iran categorically rejected a report by the Times newspaper in London that Iran tried last year to buy from South Africa several items needed to build nuclear weapons.

The statement, issued by the official news agency IRNA, said "all the nuclear activities in Islamic Iran are for peaceful purposes and their activities are under the full control of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)".
Iran's media last month quoted the head of the IAEA, Hans Blix, as saying during a visit to Tehran that the Islamic republic's nuclear capability was for peaceful purposes.
The United States has accused Iran of seeking to develop nuclear weapons, a charge Tehran has repeatedly denied.
